question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: remove_fee_type()] [Empty Fee Types] Can all fee types be removed leaving fee_types as an empty vector, making fee payments impossible and DoSing the queue? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: remove_fee_type()] [Last Fee Type Removal] If only SUI fee type exists and it's removed, can users pay fees at all? Does this brick the queue? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: add_fee_type()] [Fee Type Spam] Can an attacker add hundreds of fee types to the fee_types vector, causing excessive gas costs for has_fee_type() checks? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: has_fee_type()] [Type Name Attack] Can has_fee_type() be fooled by creating a fake Coin<T> type with the same type name but different module? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: remove_fee_type()] [Index Manipulation] Does swap_remove() in remove_fee_type() maintain vector integrity when removing from middle positions? Can this cause fee_types corruption? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: new()] [Initial Fee Type Lock] New queues are initialized with only Coin<SUI> in fee_types - if SUI is removed and no other types added, is the queue permanently bricked? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: set_queue_key()] [Queue Key Collision] Can queue_key be changed to match another existing queue's key, causing oracle submissions to route incorrectly? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: set_queue_key()] [Empty Queue Key] Can queue_key be set to an empty vector, making it impossible to identify the queue off-chain? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: set_last_queue_override_ms()] [Timestamp Overflow] Can last_queue_override_ms be set to u64::MAX, causing overflow in timestamp comparisons? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: set_last_queue_override_ms()] [Backwards Time Travel] Can last_queue_override_ms be set to a past timestamp, making the queue appear older than it is? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: set_last_queue_override_ms()] [Future Timestamp] Can last_queue_override_ms be set to a far future timestamp, affecting queue override logic? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: add_existing_oracle()] [Package Privilege Abuse] Since add_existing_oracle() is public(package), can any module in the switchboard package add malicious oracles without authority checks? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: set_configs()] [Config Manipulation] Since set_configs() is public(package), can other package modules bypass authority checks and modify critical queue parameters? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: set_authority()] [Authority Hijacking] Since set_authority() is public(package), can a malicious module in the package steal authority without consent? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: set_guardian_queue_id()] [Guardian Queue Hijacking] Can a package module call set_guardian_queue_id() to redirect guardian checks to a controlled queue? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: add_fee_type()] [Fee Type Injection] Can malicious package modules add arbitrary fee types including fake coins? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: remove_fee_type()] [Fee Type Removal Attack] Can a package module remove all valid fee types, DoSing fee collection? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: new()] [Double Initialization] If new() is called twice with the same parameters, are two identical queues created with potentially conflicting state? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: new()] [Queue Key Uniqueness] Is there any check preventing two queues from being created with identical queue_key values? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: new()] [Invalid Parameter Initialization] Can new() be called with min_attestations=0, fee=u64::MAX, or oracle_validity_length_ms=0, creating a misconfigured queue from the start? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: new()] [Guardian Queue Logic] When is_guardian_queue is false but guardian_queue_id parameter is provided, is there validation that this ID actually points to a valid guardian queue? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: new()] [Authority Zero Address] Can new() accept authority=@0x0, creating a queue with no valid authority? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: new()] [Shared Object Timing] Both guardian and regular queues are shared via transfer::share_object - can they be accessed before initialization is complete? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: add_existing_oracle()] [Table Add Without Check] Does table.add() revert if the key already exists, or does it silently overwrite? If it overwrites, this is a critical oracle replacement vulnerability. (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: existing_oracles_contains()] [Table Contains Race] Can existing_oracles_contains() return false while another transaction adds the same oracle_key, creating a TOCTOU race condition? (Medium)
